column1: Conduct disorder is a set of ongoing emotional and behavioral problems that occurs in children and teens.
Conduct disorder has been linked to: - Child abuse - Drug or alcohol abuse in the parents - Family conflicts - Genetic defects - Poverty The diagnosis is more common among boys.
Conduct disorder is often linked to attention-deficit disorder.
Children with conduct disorder may go on to develop personality disorders as adults, particularly antisocial personality disorder.
As their behaviors worsen, these individuals may also develop problems with drug abuse and the law.
